intro: Aster hesperius var. gaspensis, commonly known as the Gaspé aster, is a perennial herb native to the northeastern regions of North America. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. The plant produces showy, violet-blue to purple flowers in the late summer and early fall. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variety is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
